New Records: Canada recorded their first-ever win in T20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Nicholas Kirton scored 49 runs off 35 balls.
Shreyas Movva contributed 37 runs in 36 deliveries.
Junaid Siddiqui and Saad Bin Zafar bowled effectively, each taking a wicket.
Dilon Heyliger took two wickets in the middle overs.
Jeremy Gordon took a crucial wicket in the final over.
Post-Match Reflections: Saad Bin Zafar expressed pride in his team's performance and credited the bowlers and key batsmen.
Paul Stirling acknowledged the tough loss and emphasized the need for improvement.
Nicholas Kirton, the Player of the Match, highlighted the importance of his partnership with Shreyas Movva and the execution of their plans.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium played better than expected.
Canada's win marked the second time they have beaten a Test-playing nation in a T20I game, both wins against Ireland.
